website_summaries.verdict: Offers a comprehensive menu of modes and intensities for exceptional therapy.
pros: Effective for strengthening and pain management
cons: It costs more if you want the lifetime warranty

customer_reviews.title: Limited lifetime warranty is a SCAM
customer_reviews.text: Item worked ok. All the modes feel about the same. Don't need so many selections if they are all going to feel the same. My main issue is their 'so called' limited lifetime warranty. My unit quit working, and for only $19.95, they will service the unit and send it back to me. I never knew you had to pay for a free limited lifetime warranty. I will NEVER buy from this corrupt company again. If you buy, I hope you get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin von Allmen

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Better one in the link
customer_reviews.text: The voltage/amperage blend is all screwed up. This is one of the most painful TENS units I've ever had. I've owned 7 different brands of them and this is by far the worst.if you are a newbie to Tens, start with  It's the best bang for the buck and appropriately calibrated to the action potential of a human myocyte!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: I was suffering terribly and paid for same day shipping
customer_reviews.text: I was suffering terribly and paid for same day shipping. I ordered it in the afternoon and it arrived by 5:30 p.pm.!! I read all of the prior reviews from users, and many were so positive. I am so glad I purchased this unit - it is everything I had hoped for. I have RA and it affects several different areas. No problem - with this TENS unit, I can place the electrodes on the different spots and get relief all at once. It has eight electrode pads. Shoulders, hips, back - all getting treatment at once. I would definitely recommend this unit. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intolerable. Poor intensity management.
customer_reviews.text: I've used TENS units for over 25 years. I received this one today and was highly dissatisfied. On the lowest intensity setting, it's entirely imperceptible. When the intensity is increased just one level, it's entirely intolerable (way too intense). I called customer service, thinking perhaps I had a faulty unit that they'd want to replace. Their response was to tell me that this unit is made like that. They added that it's only recommended for elderly patients with very limited sensation. I am in my forties. By my estimate (and according to their logic), you might want to wait until you're in your 130's before you try this unit.
customer_reviews.author: GuyFromOhio

customer_reviews.title: It Works🤩🤩
customer_reviews.text: I have an L4 disc injury and try different things to relief the pain. Being a Transportation Mgr I spend a lot of time in trailer yard moving around. Doing this when I came home woke up to no pain for the first time. Buying one for a family member with knee, back issues. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Miesha

customer_reviews.title: Overpowered at the lowest setting.
customer_reviews.text: I've used multiple TENS units and this one is very overpowered at the lowest setting to the point it is painful, even when over large muscles. This is as far as I can tell useless except as a torture device. I am currently berating myself for missing the short return window and getting stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Way too big to be practical
customer_reviews.text: Unit is cheaply made and too large. You can clip it to your clothes but due to the length it falls off regularly. I bought a different one that is much smaller. Unfortunately this couldn't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: INTENSE
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this unit. It has ten functions to choose from for different parts of your body. I don't pay attention for where it's labeled to be used and whichever I think feels the best. The intensity of the pulses is MUCH greater than my last unit of a different brand. This unit I can put on a 3, for if I'm feeling up for torture. My old unit I could put up to 8 out of 10 on the intensity setting. I wish the unit included even more pads, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought two others - and returned them both! so why did I buy a third???? well, it just seemed to have a 'deeper' vibration than the little one I bought earlier. plus I wanted one with batteries for overseas travel (as opposed to a rechargeable one). I returned the first one because the left side terminals stopped working. the second one gave me shocks. surely, I thought, a third would be ok. so just after the amazon return window closed, the left side terminals stopped working. then the screen went blank - but it worked. today - zip. the screen flashes. and I know the company return policy is awful. I would not recommend this very badly made unit.
customer_reviews.author: sara21

customer_reviews.title: Their lifetime warranty is a lie
customer_reviews.text: Lasted for a few months and used sparingly before it stopped delivering a pulse. I then tried to use the lifetime warranty information that they touted and they want $20 and for you to ship it...on a $27 item so essentially you would be buying a refurbished one for the same price. It worked decent while it worked. A detailed list of what each of the pre-set functions did would have been nice but are not included.
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Will shock the crap out of you anything above the first setting.
customer_reviews.text: The lowest setting is ok you can barely feel the pulses but clicking it up to the second is unbearable. It feels like a stud gun I can't imagine the highest setting. Maybe mine was defective but returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: G3 TACO

customer_reviews.title: Not Useful
customer_reviews.text: It is not useful at all to ease my hand's pain. The current is TOO strong that gave me a very unusual heart beat. I stop using it afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: So strong I felt like I was being shocked...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how bad this thing was until I bought one I found after doing a search online and seeing an article by a subsidiary of the New York Times. This thing shocked me and was never gentle enough to be used on my hands and wrists. I cant imagine that someone at the FDA actually approved this, but that is stated here. Sorry, when you sell me something that makes me feel like I being shocked, I feel something should be said. Lower power settings are needed.
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorDesigner

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to ride the lightning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife. She had tried another brand, but based on a lot of the reviews we decided to go with this one. It is way to powerful for her. Even on the lowest setting. She said it is a very significant and uncomfortable “jolt”. And that is the lowest setting. She tried to adjust it and tinker with it, but to no avail. And now the window to return has closed and we are stuck with a portable electric chair.
customer_reviews.author: Flique

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of the unit but I was very disappointed that two of the four wires I have used so far have one lead that doesn’t work. Both wires are like that. So, out of 4 patch wires only 2 work. I haven’t bothered to even try the other two because I was and am so disgusted. I read the reviews and these reviews were pretty good. Those reviews do not shed the whole truth. I’m past the window of returning this. So, now I’m out the money and I own a piece of junk. I don’t even bother using it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Eh, Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After reading the great reviews and researching, this item seemed like a wonderful solution. I would occasionally get some muscle pain (back, neck, shoulders) and don't have quite enough time to get to my chiropractor. I purchased this product for those in-between visits times. I imagined that since it is not doctor's-office equipment, it would start at a very low setting and be able to move up as needed. Even the absolute lowest one is beyond high for me. Also, the standard timer setting is excessively above anything I have ever heard recommended by a physician. The product is very inexpensive but at this point a waste of money for me as I can barely use it.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold for pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine November 2019. I use it frequently for back pain. For the last few days I've had it on nearly nonstop because of shoulder and arm pain that the Dr has been treating for weeks with medicine that hasn't done a thing. When I told her I started using the Tens unit and was no longer in debilitating pain while I had it on she approved me to keep using it as well as switching her medication again. I'm recommending to everyone. I finally bought replacement pads earlier this week for the first time because of losing stickiness after 9 months of use. And the new pads are larger. 😁 This is a great deal all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Katze

customer_reviews.title: i am going to get this for everyone for X'mas
customer_reviews.text: I read the mixed review and was still a little skeptical but man, am I glad i bought this. I tried it immed. different setting on legs, ankles and wrists. Different intensity and different setting and I am a new person. My legs have serious issues and required frequent massage to get rid of the amino acid and knots. The little device packs lots more power than one can expect. Honestly for this price, even if it goes out in couple months, it's still worth it. A massage cost 4 times as much. I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Shocking indeed
customer_reviews.text: Makes me twitch all over. Yowzee wowzee. I am using the TENS unit on my knee following a TKR. Does it help? Does it alleviate the discomfort from the surgery? Yeah, I dunno. Maybe. Maybe not. The jury is out. The device works for sure. I mean it definitely sends little bursts of shocking energy into my leg. Yep. It does that indeed. But does that actually facilitate healing? My guess is.....probably not. But perhaps the placebo effect is worth it. So regarding efficacy of TENS....my PT and my surgeon just roll their eyes. But does the unit itself work? Yes. It does.
customer_reviews.author: bopfan

customer_reviews.title: not a fan
customer_reviews.text: controller is fairly large so it wont stay in my pocket at work, if you put it in your pocket and one of the buttons is hit on accident it changes the settings because there is no lock on them which also resets the intensity. The modes are rather limiting. If you have actual pain that you are treating with this instead of using it for temporary soreness or the like, the intensity is fairly limited. it IS nice to have 4 outputs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Golden

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED USED PRODUCT!  Has another persons personal body ick on the Sticky Electrodes
customer_reviews.text: I received a used product. 1. No outer packaging _this was my first sign it had been used. (this is my second purchase of same item) 2. Resealable package for instructions empty. Instructions loose and in disarray in main package. 3. Batteries not in battery compartment. 4. Device itself was not in it's plastic packaging. 5. Batteries found inside Device. 6. Sticky part of electrodes contained another persons skin, hair, etc. In my opinion, this is an item that should not be reshipped after being returned.
customer_reviews.author: RaeRae Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed quick. They claim "lifetime warranty". Instead they want to charge you almost the same price for replacement. Scam
customer_reviews.text: Unit failed after max 20 times use. They claim "lifetime warranty". Seller/Manufacturer wants $19.95 for "service" and return of the failed unit at my cost. With this math it's easier to buy a brand new unit.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: As promised for excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use out of the box. Pretty self-explanatory. Good bargain for the money. The sensation created by the software in particular the back mode I found really soothing and relieving. If you order this device definitely order some extra pads. The ones that come with the unit which they're only for pear are subpar and really can only be used one time. Aside from the pads but you need to buy more anyway because if you plan to use the machine you just simply need to have more pads recommended different style. The machine itself is a great Buy and well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the best machine ever. I bought this for myself and my daughter, haven't seen it much since my daughter got a hold of it. She has arthritis, inflammation problems and muscle and ligament problems. I have used this myself two times for pulled muscles and to my surprise it worked well. I am pleased with this machine and my daughter loves it and uses it every day. Well spent money. The sticky pads do not stay sticky for long, I suggest you buy extra replacement pads..
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: You just to find your comfort level as the higher settings can be quite uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after remembering a similar apparatus was used on my lower back (Herniated Disc) in physical therapy some years back and after reading other reviews, so I figured why not try? I suffer from Rheumatoid Arthritis in various joints, bad Rotator Cuff, worn knees, etc. I've used this on my shoulder and right knee a couple of times and noticed instant relief each time, I also had a stressed back this weekend right before an event shoot (Professional Portrait Photographer over 22 years) and used this all night, I couldn't have made it through my 7hour coverage without it! So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: DaBiggSho

customer_reviews.title: Works for pain but not all the time
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is great. I didn't like that only 2 out of the 8 pads work so that was frustrating since you can't use all 4 pads at once. I tried with different cords and tested each pad but only 2 will function so that is a waste. It really helped my achilles, feet, and tight calves. I use the hypervolt too and this really helped my sore feet. I am a runner and work out everyday so it is awesome for recovery. The control is easy to use and well made. It is a shot in the dark though with the brand new device being sent with some defective pads.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived not functioning, not refundable, no customer service to resolve the issues. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jen C

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Pads do have to be replaced as many of those types of pads wish they'd made ones that were washable so they could be washed instead of throw away(not sure if there is any). But the unit itself is very good my sister even wants one cuz she really likes it (she's tried many and have not liked them) also wish they had a rechargeable unit is my own personal preference but otherwise excellent don't need it on really high to feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I came across this product while ordering a decompression back belt, and saw the thousands of positive reviews. Since I was suffering from shoulder, neck, elbow and lower back pains, I thought I'd try it since it was so affordable. I love everything about it except that there's no backlight for the buttons, which makes it difficult to see in low light. The intensity jumps from level to level, and I rarely go past the third level (depending on which body part is being massaged). I've used it on my shoulder pain which I've had for years, and it's gone away. It's a great personal PMS unit and I love the fact that I can take it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: D. Suguitan

customer_reviews.title: Unit is okay for the money but has a lot of drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few months back and have used it several times. It serves its purpose but there's a lot of functionality missing that you would think it would have. If you want to just simply turn it on and pulse a certain rate, you can't do that. There is no manual option you have to use its pre-programmed options which sometimes I just want a steady pulse not bursts and all the other pre-programmed options that has. You would think that would be a simple thing for a unit to have but it's not in this unit from what I've seen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Electrodes don’t last 1 day
customer_reviews.text: I like the device but my issue is with the electrode pads. I know they are replaceable, but these pads did not last even one day before falling off and refusing to stick again. Yes, I made sure my skin was clean and free of ang lotion or anything. Yes, I cleaned the electrodes to see if it helps. Nothing helps. There is no reason why I would want to buy a new pair of electrodes for every 1/2 day of use. I bought this for all day wear while I am at school, but it looks like it won’t work for that.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: works good except channel a1
customer_reviews.text: My hip was sore, sprained muscle maybe. I used this everyday for a month on different settings. The pain is gone. Suddenly the A1 channel stopped working. The a2,b1,b2 channels still work. I'm returning it. The other channels may work forever or they may fail next week. Just for fun I applied the pads to my neck under my ears. That felt good too. I was hoping it would work like an alpha wave stimulator. Maybe it did. I feel more relaxed. The belt hook is very short, it doesn't hold in place. It needs to be 2x as long. The pads are sticky, I'm still using the same ones. To renew the stickiness I wiped them with rubbing alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: mungo

customer_reviews.title: is not mobil like it states! Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this item. I thought it was made to pt on and clip to my belt and move freely around. Every time I move ti sit or stand it stops and I have to restart it all over again. So It works well if your sitting in one place and not moving around. Lasted only 4 months. Then quit!
customer_reviews.author: Roseanne

customer_reviews.title: Almost too powerful. Wrong pad holder
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new tens unit and this one sounded great for the price plus it comes with 8 pads that can all be used at the same time. Just put it on my wife for the first time today. The 2nd to lowest setting is almost too strong. I can't imagine going up even halfway. The pads are almost too sticky. The pad holder is not meant for square pads, more for oval or figure 8 shaped pads. You cannot put two pads on one side without overhanging the edges. Considering there are eight pads it should have at least come with two pad holders of the correct size and that is the reason for only giving 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing machine and so affordable! Me likey!
customer_reviews.text: I have this for neuropathic pain, carpotunnel and degenerative disc pain and other various and sundry injuries. Just a barrel of fun I am. I have had this since March of last year and still haven't needed to replace the batteries and it runs for 80 minutes at a time! That is how efficient it is. It has such a wide range of modes, it blows others away. I prefer the "hip" mode for all my therapy - it delivers the best results. I can't say enough good things about this. I don't know what I would do without it! Me likey!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works just as good as expensive units for half the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as expensive TENS units but for a fraction of the price. Provides pain relief as expected. The sticky pads that came with it do not stick well. It does work with other brand pads that do though. Battery life is great & I love the auto shutoff feature because I often fall asleep with it on. The different patterns really help on extremely painful days. I’d definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: THIS MACHINE STOPS PAIN!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my best purchases I made for the year. I have some serious lower back issues and was told that this little machine can help. I thought to myself, what do I have to loose for the price. This machine has helped me beyond words. My wife and kids also use the machine to help as well. Well worth the price. The adhesive sides on the pads last a long time if you make sure you skin is clean and no oils are present. If you have pains I highly recommend you get yourself machine. It helps relieve the pains while taking no medications. It’s a win, win situation!
customer_reviews.author: PE

customer_reviews.title: This device is super powerful! I put this on expecting to have ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is super powerful! I put this on expecting to have to turn up the power, but I was wrong. On the first setting, I felt nothing. The second setting was already too much! I don't know if I just need to figure out the control buttons, but my neck actually hurt afterward. I have only tried it once. If I get some better results next time, I will update this. Either way, there needs to be a gradual increase in settings so people can find a comfortable mode.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for the price! I have had 3 different machines of varying pricepoints and none of them are as good as this one. It has so many options and features. Each lead actually holds 2 electrodes giving this machine the capability to use 8 pads. The pads it comes with are the small square ones but can easily be swapped with pads of different size/shape. I primarily use on my lower back for SI joint dysfunction. Having 8 pads makes it easy to treat the entire area in one session and not have to stop for repositioning. The leads are very long so you can sit or lay comfortable without accidentally pulling them out of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This product really shocked me when I started to use it. Main reason I was looking into these products was for my sciatica nerve pain in my leg. I was lucky to find this was on a lightning sale on Amazon and the ratings were great, so I thought "why not?". I love the many features it has and love how many different places I can put the sticky pads. Also there is a 3 month warranty included in the package if needed. Like I said, wow.. It help relieve some of the pain after 80 minutes of use. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Just like the chiropractor!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has severe low back/buttock pain. A month in physical therapy did nothing for him. I bought him this and instant relief! This is just as good as the chiropractor's. Love the ability to have 2 different circuits A/B so you can have more intense therapy delivered to a different body part but treat more than one at a time. Great power and also option for different massage types--kneading, acupressure, cupping, scraping, etc. My ONLY beef is that the option buttons are this weird blue color and not backlit so with my lame eyes, they are kinda hard to read. No biggie!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca I

customer_reviews.title: Hundreds of hours of use and still working.
customer_reviews.text: Does this device eliminate my pain? No. Does this device reduce my pain by 60 to 70 percent? Yes. I have been on disability for psoriatic arthritis since 2001. I don't have a lot of money to spare. I paid $40 for this (April of 2015)and I considered it a bargain. I already had a Icy Hot back tens but one location of pain reduction wasn't enough. PROS: A lot less pain. CONS: It is fairly bulky to carry around and I have had problems with the batteries popping out of place (which I fixed by putting a piece of pasteboard between the batteries and the battery cover).
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Russell

customer_reviews.title: The leads on this are proprietary!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had my back go out over the winter. I purchased more leads; a port doubler, & others to make this more useful. But the industry standards for leads come in 3 types. But this Tens unit manufacturer has changed to their own input plug. This takes a very versatile device; and restricts it very much. I would buy some other brand; even though most of the review on here are very positive. If you are looking for a versatile Tens unit; then look at some other Tens unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Love it. My boyfriend and I both workout hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My boyfriend and I both workout hard and both have been rehabbing from injury. This is a great quality machine with tonnes of different settings. We love it - to the point where we are fighting over who gets to use it. It feels lovely on and I do feel like I get relief from pain after using it (not completely, but I can feel a difference). You don't need to go spend all your money on a fancy machine, this does the job. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pain Relief.
customer_reviews.text: After using this product for several years I felt a review was necessary. I have lower back pain and it is most painful when I wale up in morning. I use Healthmate forever starting the day when I have a cup of coffee. There is almost instant relief from Pain. This product is better than any cream or pill. I have been careless and dropped the product on a tile floor three times over the years. It always continues working when I reassemble. I was referred to this product by my son who also has back pain. I can recommend this product without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: NitnanyLion

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn’t. About 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit back in July (it’s now 11/12/19) and it was working wonderfully, until that is, a few weeks ago. Now it’s malfunctioning. After changing its batteries the first time, the unit wouldn’t send any current through the pads and then would randomly shock me. I called the customer service number and they gave me the run around about getting it replaced or refunded. The lady hardly spoke any English and just kept saying to “test it”. Don’t waste your money on this one. Look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: BabyGiraffe

customer_reviews.title: Painful shock
customer_reviews.text: Let me start out by saying I have no experience with TENS devices outside of my physical therapist using one on me when I go there. When he starts it out there are very small vibrations. If you increase the intensity you do feel a slight shock and I tell him okay not that one and everything is normal again. With this device the lowest "knee" setting gave me a very painful shock. Twenty minutes later as I write this it still hurts. Good luck to anyone using this device.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand all of the great reviews, this is nothing more than a massage ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all of the great reviews, this is nothing more than a massage unit. I would return it if I had saved the external packaging. I am glad however that it is helping others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer WA

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I had cervical fusion of C5 to C7 when in 2010 and an Arthroplasty in November of C4. I have had these put on me at PT and this one works just as well. Mu only complaint is the size. When I clip it on my waist it falls off a lot and there is nothing else to do, but to carry it. It would be awesome if you guys came up with a belt or made the unit smaller. Otherwise love love love it!! It helps with my pain control tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: AUDRA BUTLER

customer_reviews.title: Company does not stand behind product
customer_reviews.text: Beware the marketing about lifetime warranty. I purchased this a couple of years ago and it worked well enough for a while. Unfortunately, it developed an issue where it would shut itself off when bumped into my arm or thigh. When I contacted the company, they indicated I had to provide extensive documentation to validate the issue, pay to ship it to them AND include payment for return shipping & handling. This added up to most hassle and expense than simply purchasing a brand new one. Not much of a warranty after all.
customer_reviews.author: golconda

customer_reviews.title: Works like a professional product
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I was doubtful for the same price I paid at target I would end up with a machine that actually worked but this product WORKS! It's amazing power for it's size keep working on your pain until it's manageable again. At the physical therapy office I usually request the machine up so high they watch me for part of my treatment expecting me to request it be turned down but this product I couldn't go higher than 4 and had to stay primarily at 3. Save your liver from all the damage from taking Advil, no need to be drowsy all day from muscle relaxers...BUY this amazing product. Best use of $30 in at least 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Cylonathena

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever !!
customer_reviews.text: Right Out Of The Box ! Sticky Patch On Forearm ! Pointy On Bad Tooth ! Switch On ! Then Punch The Intensity ! Gently ! In Just Eight Minutes ! Pain And Swelling Gone ! Thanks Amazon ! Why 3-20 Minutes Secessions With The Old Unit Epic Failed ? YouTube/s Square Wave Effect On Bacteria Was Awesome ! Lethal ! Quick ! Amplitude And Higher Frequency Making It Quicker ! True Love ! Didn't Need Nearly All Those Buttons ! And Only One Hook UP ! But There If Needed ! And Played With Them Anyway ! Very Nice Machine !
customer_reviews.author: t49y

customer_reviews.title: Great product... but the adhesive pads don’t last long. Buy extra!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really love this! Be careful with the intensity though, it can be a little startling at first. But it’s definitely worth the money. My only complaint is how quickly the pads loose their adhesion. I only adjusted the pads once and they already lost their ability to properly stick to the skin. So I’d definitely recommend buying extra pads for this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Clementine

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item
customer_reviews.text: The fact that it has a lifetime warranty gives you an idea how confident the manufacturer is. I bought this for my mother as she has a lot of pain on her IT band and Psoas area. As she is not technologically savvy, she finds the manual control a lot easier to handle. I also like that this doesn't require charging and uses AAA batteries as we always have spare batteries in our household (it came with one set of free batteries btw).
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Wowser
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is terrific. How did I not know about TENS before? If you regularly have pain or even seldomly do you should get this. Heck, sometimes I use it when I had no pain and just to relax. My TENS journey started with a TENS7000, which is awesome, but after trying this one I'm sold on all the extra modes. Holy smokes. While the build quality of this unit isn't as robust as the TENS7000...those extra modes are amazing. So if you seem to drop everything go for the TENS7000 otherwise give this thing a go and be ready to be amazed
customer_reviews.author: FactionMan

customer_reviews.title: Bad for My Stiff Muscles; Creates More Pain
customer_reviews.text: It's unclear whether this is a TENS or an EPM. The old TENS unit at my chiropractor's office feels great and relieves tension. This device contracts the muscle (like you're flexing) and makes my muscles absolutely painful. I have a high pain tolerance and I absolutely cannot stand this machine to be higher than 5/10. It's absolutely useless for me and causes so much more muscular pain. I was hoping it would relax my overworked/tense muscles like my chiropractor's TENS machine, but this little box just makes my muscles even more sore and tender and stiff.
customer_reviews.author: E. White

customer_reviews.title: Good for price but.....read
customer_reviews.text: I kept it because I didn’t feel right on returning this type of item after opening one set of pads I got it to replace an Empi tens unit that lasted 25 years and had both variable intensity and frequency This unit only has variable intensity, different frequencies that I was used to are better for different spots Overall it is strong, just doesn’t do what I want I ended up spending 150 for a unit that is comparable to my Empi from outside site But for the price, it is a good deal
customer_reviews.author: Tooljunky

customer_reviews.title: Sore and painful - stay away
customer_reviews.text: After using this device on the 2nd setting for 20 minutes for 2 days, my shoulder blade muscle and neck muscle was sore and in pain. I used it once on my knee and it became numb for several days. I know it is from the machine because prior to using this, I didn't have this problem. I have used the one in the physical therapy office with no issue even on a high setting. Not this device, it hurts instead. Stay away from this cheaply made device as it does more harms and good.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Effective pain relief for muscles
customer_reviews.text: Learning how best to use this on yourself can be a bit of a process, even if you’ve had a chiropractor/etc. use a similar device. Very effective for muscle pain. Not super portable, what with all the wires, so it’s best as a session rather than an all-day thing. It’s more of an EMS than a TENS, per se, because the muscles will contract and release as it operates. TENS currents as I understand them are more for distraction as a pain reliever, whereas an EMS also works the muscles a bit, presumably leading to increased myalgia relief longer. Plenty intense- I haven’t ever even gotten it up halfway to max.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile85

customer_reviews.title: A frien recommended this for back pain
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by a friend who swears that it helps her back pain. I haven’t tried it yet as my back got better before it arrived. As I hurt my back quite often i’m sure I will get a lot of use out of it. My husband who has a bad hip was very excited to try it, but he has a metal heart valve, so can’t use it. Be sure to read the manual, especially if you have any implants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful!  Much better than other units I've used before.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful. And is has a plethora of settings. You can set four of the pads to one function, while the other four do another. The pads included are good quality and feel like they will last quite a while if well cared for. I purchased an extra set to be safe. I looked around a while to find the best deal -- while this may not still be the best deal, these are the pads I bought:. The instructions are written in somewhat broken english but it's easy to get the gist of how things work. Be aware that even the lowest setting is pretty powerful feeling. Hard to believe it's only powered by three AAA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: J. Haug

customer_reviews.title: Sanity saver
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who lives with chronic pain understands how frustrating it is to live in constant agony. I have a herniated disc, and although it is not a cure- all, it definenatly takes the edge off of the pain. The other feature that I like about this product is that the chords are very long and you can discretly tuck them into your clothes. And the price--can't beat it. If you plan on using daily, I would recommend purchasing extra electrodes--also worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: gkfromjax

customer_reviews.title: my husband can be hard to impress so I wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: my husband can be hard to impress so I wasn't putting much stock into this product but thought I'd give it a try. He injured his back years ago at work and will occasionally have pain and seizing of the muscles that will lay him up. He tried it the fist week we received and then came to me and said "that thing....it's strong! Really works!" That is a glowing review from him.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi M.

customer_reviews.title: Not a single setting is continuous stim, all have on/off cycles.
customer_reviews.text: Ehhh, advertised as an tens unit but all labeling says ems. None of the settings provided a continuous electrical stimulation, they all have an on off cycle. The variation between intensity 1 and 2 is extreme. If you need just a little stronger you can’t because the intensity jump is too high. The different body part settings just make it more complicated than having a type, duration, and interval options would have been way better. Primary use for the unit was for labor pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: So Good I Had To Buy A Second!
customer_reviews.text: This little device is fantastic and doesn't break the bank. I had a car accident back in the fall of 2013 and it screwed up my back with muscle spasms. Over time some of it went away but it never goes away. So I knew that I couldn't keep on going to a chiropractor, so I ended up buying this. This has saved me a lot of time and money from going going to someone to do this for me. Highly recommended! Had to buy a 2nd one because my family took my other one hostage haha 😂!
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: It at least gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I wont say that I don't like this product but its no were near medical grade (as expected) there are lots of options on it and it really helped with my carpal tunnel during pregnancy but the pads that come with it will wear out within a weeks time if you use it often. It honestly did shock me on occasion and some of the output levels were just uncomfortable. sometimes it just felt like a constant stinging instead of a muscle simulator. Would I buy it again? Eh.......probably not. But I wouldnt know really were to look for another one thats better. This one is not horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca S

customer_reviews.title: This tazer is cleverly disguised as a health device.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my son in the military because he needed one. This unit is a tazer! He didnt have it turned up but he said it was shocking the bejesus out of him and he has no problem handling pain. He is on snapchat zapping himself and said he couldn't use it as it appears dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielleup10

customer_reviews.title: When the unit came the on and off button didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: When the unit came the on and off button didn't work. I returned it and got another unit. It has A and B channels. Channel A didn't work. Returned it and got a different unit from a different manufacturer. The documentation was so small that even with my 3.0 reading glasses I couldn't see it. Plus the documentation was so meager that it probably wouldn't have helped much. I went out and bought a different manufactures unit, the iReliev TENS Unit. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: David Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, except for...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this TENS unit. INDEPENDENT channels, which I need due to altered sensation from waist down due to spinal cord injury were great, esp with FOUR! I can't remember if it locked or not, but if it didn't, that would be a problem. My BIG problem was the size of the unit. It's huge, & I didn't even think of that when I ordered it. If it were pocket sized, it would've been perfect 😩. IF you have a better way to carry it than your back pocket, at least give it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Surgteam

customer_reviews.title: Works but already had problems
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait to give a review . Yes it does work. I have degenerative disc disease, 2 herniated discs and spinal stenosis which my spine specialist recommended I try one of these for. The almost instant relief is amazing. The cons: the buttons don't light up which would be helpful, If I move or pressure is on the cord sometimes I get shocked. 1st pair of pads after me only using them a handful of times would no longer work. It's a great machine and a bang for your buck but I do wonder how long this machine will last.
customer_reviews.author: Wildflower9013

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and strong unit
customer_reviews.text: I got FDA cleared OTC HealthmateForever YK15AB TENS unit on sale only $20. First of all, I wouldn't believe it works well for the price. After a few months to have it I really enjoy using this one much more another unit I paid almost double. The electrode pads came with this unit stick better and last longer than the ones came with the TechCare Plus24. For a long time use I highly recommend people buying this unit because it is not cheap to buy new electrode pads for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel SVL

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but huge
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great, the batteries last a fair amount of time, even with constant use, and it has enough settings to suit anyone’s needs. That being said, I ordered a smaller one, because the unit is so large it bothers me. If it is in my pocket, I cannot move, and if I clip it to the outside, it is difficult to hide under my clothing. I do like a small, pocket-sized unit, and this is 2”longer than my Direct TV remote. It is still a wonderful unit, and I will continue to use it, but if you know you will be bothered by the size, order a smaller unit to start with.
customer_reviews.author: K. Raynolds

customer_reviews.title: Prompt and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my husband who has low back pain. Received quickly. Pads and unit seem very well made. He started using it about two weeks ago and is amazed at the results! Says it’s like getting a massage and blocking the pain at same time. He uses it at night and sleeps much more soundly. However, the instruction booklet is NOT helpful at all, so there are several functions he still doesn’t know how to utilize.
customer_reviews.author: Zeesal

customer_reviews.title: Not only is it a fun, enjoyable massage
customer_reviews.text: If your considering purchasing, YOU NEES THIS ITEM!!!! This little unit really packs a punch! I had initial concerns about it being not strong enough, as its powers by a few small batteries, but WOW. I can just tolerate a level 2 and it works wonders. Not only is it a fun, enjoyable massage, the pain relief after is unbelievable. Sitting long periods irritates my back and causes great shoulder pain, I slap these babies on there and zap away as I work. I have already recommended to friends and family and enjoy sharing my experiences!
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Directions
customer_reviews.text: It has a timer, WHY? There is no way to adjust the timer. From Customer Service: Dear customer Thank you for your message, unfortunately the adjusting the time section in the YK15AB user manual is an error, on that specific model there is no way to adjust the time. I apologize for the misunderstanding. And as far as I can see there is no way to adjust the SPEED either, this is not an easy item to figure, and I cannot believe how bad the directions are.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend this unit for basic pain relief and muscle relaxation
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself works with no issues. The only issue I have is that the sticky stuff on the pads come off on your skin after the first use. That being said, pads are very cheap so I bought replacements. FYI: The unit has 4 channels A1, A2, B1, B2, During use all channels put out the same "signal or electricity" A1 and A2 have an intensity setting and B1 and B2 have a separate intensity setting. I definitely recommend this unit for basic pain relief and muscle relaxation.
customer_reviews.author: DSturrock

customer_reviews.title: Strong!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a collegiate athlete and had access to the top STEM machines when I had back pain so when I bought this I wasn’t expecting much. I don’t feel like it helps if it’s not at a higher setting so maybe I’m just use to it but I barely feel the lowest level. I read a ton of reviews that anything over one is unbearable and painful but I’m writing this sitting comfy at level 4. It runs for 90 minutes and I’ll probably increase it twice before it’s over. This is a great one for people who need to be hit a little harder than most. I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Ok product but can’t compare with actual masseuse
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my mom to use but had to returned it since it does not deliver the expected result advertised. Perhaps my expectations was too high since it’s just a little device, which can’t compare to an actual masseuse that’s for sure. I was hoping it can deliver some sort of comfort to my mom since everything was locked down at the time that was purchased. Lesson learned. Lowered expectations will lead to more happiness.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best I've bought!
customer_reviews.text: In short, I love this thing! I have periodic back and knee pain (decades of competitive weightlifting) and recently had rotator cuff surgery. This TENS unit allows me to stimulate multiple body parts at the same time with the 4 separate leads. I've tried various units over the years, and this one is easily the best I've ever had... so good that I've even bought/shipped a few to family and teammates. It's a beautiful thing!
customer_reviews.author: Monterio

customer_reviews.title: Electrifying
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this item, in the past I went to physical therapy and they would use a similar device for treatment for my herniated disc. So when I discovered that I had a punched nerve I searched and discovered this item. I literally use it every day. I put it in my pocket book and carry it where ever.i go. I even sleep with it on my night stand. I tell everyone within ear shot about it and all of my family and friends have ordered one. Some of them just to keep it on hand. Its the new medicine cabinet/go to first aid kit item.
customer_reviews.author: urs131

customer_reviews.title: Use for car wreck pain & migraines
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I use it for two different reasons, but it gives great results for both. I use this for back (upper and lower), neck, arm, and hip issues due to a car wreck I had over a year ago. I also use this for my severe chronic migraines. While it doesn't really get rid of a migraine when I have one, it does help lower the pain level or at least it makes me feel better and gives me something else to focus on. I find its good for pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few times
customer_reviews.text: My mom owns one of these and loves it. My back has been hurting more than usual so I thought I'd get my own. It was working fabulously the first few times. Then I accidentally left the switch on. I turned it off and then back on, it lit up, I pushed my desired preset button, and nothing. Tried replacing the batteries, still nothing. Tried new pads, still nothing. So I gave up and returned it. I might try this again someday. Hopefully I just got a faulty one.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Benson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I pay $35 for one trip for electrical stimulation at my chiropractor. This more than pays for itself after first time. I was surprised that the little device with just a few batteries can give such a strong shock, & it helps on pain relief across my back. Just as good as my chiropractor job.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working within a month....it was fine until then. Update: customer service provided a new device. However, they promissed a shipping refund and some TENS pads, which I never received. When I contacted customer serivce, they gave me a code to get 10% off. SMH. Update....company sent another unit, it is not working and I ordered more pads which is a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Gina C

customer_reviews.title: The higher settings are for electrical execution.
customer_reviews.text: It's very, very strong. I'm 6 ft, 185lb male but the initial increase of the device is the only setting I could barely tolerate.
customer_reviews.author: seancerrito

customer_reviews.title: Seems to help with neuropathy
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be effective.I'd have let you know in a few months, but I'll probably forget. The price is excellent. I'm using it for neuropathy, not pain alleviation, so I'm running along nerve paths. I can't recommend that, because it's not in the manual, but when I start a session, I start feeling the tingling after a couple minutes. I assume that means the nerves are waking up. I've found it's best to work with two pads at a time, because I can control the intensity based on the comfort level.
customer_reviews.author: JaguarOT

customer_reviews.title: This gadget is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Despite the good reviews, I must, having tried this item, now agree with the people saying the current is WAY TOO STRONG. One reviewer stating it does nothing on the first level, and then delivers a powerful jolt on the very next setting, hit it right on the head. I have a hand problem that was immensely helped by my doctor's TENS device, but this thing nearly made me jump out of my chair. I cannot imagine what level 3 or greater would be like, but it would be useful to someone like the Gestapo, I can tell you that. Avoid this until they control the jolt.
customer_reviews.author: Quarter Twain

customer_reviews.title: Terrible intensity controls! Either no sensation at all or extremely painful shock.
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers commented, the controls on this thing take you from virtually no sensation at all to a sharply painful shocking sensation (and I am known by all my massage therapists, chiropractors, and acupuncturists to have an extremely high pain tolerance)...pretty much all or nothing with nothing useful in between. Also, there are only pre-programmed modes that are terrible because they, again, go from nothing at all to these extreme jolting shocks. Not particularly therapeutic unless you find fits of convulsions relaxing! Not sure how this thing managed to get any positive reviews at all. On the upside, it was easy to return and get my money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Wiggerella

customer_reviews.title: This is like one of the only reliefs I get for pain
customer_reviews.text: This is like one of the only reliefs I get for pain, I use it for rheumatoid arthritis on my knee and arms, i dont know what id do without this..just wish it was stronger......i put it on full power and can barely feel it. (Other family members of mine try it on low and it works almost to well for them, therefore, its just me ) but man i would still purchase it over and over, because Nothing else helps.
customer_reviews.author: Snow_White

customer_reviews.title: Large and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This does the job, but nothing special. It seems capable of more power than I can tolerate. I have 2 issues with this particular unit. The first is that it is quite large, so it's impossible to just put in a pocket and go about work. The second, and more annoying problem, is that it is hard to really see the buttons. The backlight is on the screen, not the buttons. I still have to turn on a light to figure out which option to chose. The screen is actually unnecessary, I think.
customer_reviews.author: creepy pink rat

customer_reviews.title: WOW this machine is amazing for its size especially considering how little I paid ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW this machine is amazing for its size especially considering how little I paid for it. I use the hip setting with the speed cranked all the way up. The pulsating doesn't seem to work as much as constantly being on. So hip setting + full speed + 80% power = relief for my back (well, as much as I can hope for with all of the damage). Do yourself a huge favor and upgrade the pads. If you need more coverage, I'm linking to the large pads for this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Monkey Fish Frog

customer_reviews.title: Machine works great, buy different electrodes these do not stick on so well
customer_reviews.text: It’s simple to use and feel my muscles less tense after each use. The only thing that I did not like were the adhesive on the electrodes. They kept unsticking from my skin so therefore had to throw away after each use. I ordered extra ones from a different brand and those I can reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: So THANKFUL to find this
customer_reviews.text: I am a photographer and have been struggling with inner and outer elbow pain on my shooting arm. I went the Doctor and was told the pain is just from overuse with editing for hours at a time on my computer. I was advised to message with Sports pain relief creams and take anti inflammatory meds to relieve pain. I just received this item this evening. Very easy ti use right out of the box. The message/vibration gave my elbow so much relief and felt like a message in the strained area. I have tremendous relief and almost completely pain free with only one use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Therapy in the privacy of my home
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about this but turns out this one is just as strong as the setting I have them use at the chiropractor and will turn up much higher. I have a couple of messed up disks and fibromyalgia so I use this to help work out some of those pesky muscle knots and pain. Beats going to the chiropractor three days a week, laying face down on a table “trying to relax” in an office for their therapy. The multiple settings are nice and I've been using it for a couple months now with no problems. I would probably buy the same unit again if this one ever goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a variety of functions!
customer_reviews.text: Unit works great, much more variety than expected. I can wear many more pads than I would ever need.The only drawback is that the buttons don't light, they are a pretty, dark blue but I can't see what they say unless I use my phone's flashlight! It would be helpful if they were backlit. There is also no basic, consistent function, which I prefer! If you want a variety of functions, this is a wonderful product! Remember to press a button for your target area and then choose your function or you won't realize it's on. There's also side buttons to change intensity so you don'the get an immediate jolt! It's a great product around the house!
customer_reviews.author: Trula

customer_reviews.title: Good product with lots of buttons that can seemingly be ignored
customer_reviews.text: There are a whole slew of buttons that probably do something useful, but their use escapes me. I just power it on and control the intensity. I’m happy with the results, I just think the interface is unnecessarily complicated. I think, too, that the battery case could be a little more secure as the batteries can easily be jostled out of place. Easy enough to pop the case and re-set the batteries, but I think a little foam on the back of the case would do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great, but for how long?
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this on my hip and back for only three weeks (same batteries) and I'm very impressed. My pain has diminished to tolerable levels. The product reviews that I trust most are those by people who have been using a product for several months (at least), so that I have an idea of its durability and long term effects. I have let other family members use this and their impressions are mixed; my brother wanted to buy one right away, but my wife thought it felt like being stabbed by tiny needles. I will update this review if these impressions change.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for back and neck pain!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I have chronic back and neck pain and this has been a lifesaver for me. I have had other version and I prefer this one because it has a side clip to hook on your pants while wearing it, and it also allows you to adjust the intensity for each side/port (A or B). So, if you want more intense stimulation to one area and less to another, you can adjust A and B to different settings simultaneously, giving you the ideal amount of stimulation for different locations on your body. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey T.

customer_reviews.title: A hidden gem
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly really worried about purchasing one of these online rather than from a healthcare store, but I'm honestly glad I did. You can buzz up to 4 areas as once, with 2 different intensities (mode is the same for all, however, as you can't set different modes for the A and B slots.) Great on battery power, comfortable, clean, efficient. My only complaint is that the direction booklet does not say how to set the timer, so just keep an eye on how long you have it going, my doctor recommended no more than 20 minutes at a time, maximum 4 times per day.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Rozetar

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to reinforce the connector with duct tape!
customer_reviews.text: It helps my bad lower back. I have broken a lot of cords because the connection is flimsy garbage. I love the machine, but make sure you duct tape the connection or you will throw money away replacing wires. I recommend this machine, but reinforce it.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Reviewer

product_meta.title: FDA cleared OTC HealthmateForever YK15AB TENS unit with 4 outputs, apply 8 pads at the same time, 15 modes Handheld Electrotherapy device | Electronic Pulse Massager for Electrotherapy Pain Management -- Pain Relief Therapy : Chosen by Sufferers of Tennis Elbow, Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, Arthritis, Bursitis, Tendonitis, Plantar Fasciitis, Sciatica, Back Pain, Fibromyalgia, Shin Splints, Neuropathy and other Inflammation Ailments Patent No. USD723178S
feature_bullets: All-Time best seller YK15AB is one of our most powerful TENS & Muscle Stimulators. Specifically designed mode buttons make pain management quick and easy. Simple and easy to use! Safe, Non-Invasive, All- Natural and Drug free.
Powerful Value: One of our most powerful TENS & Muscle Stimulator with 20 levels of adjustable intensity. Strong long-lasting pain relief.

Mode Buttons: Easy to read & operate buttons for each targeted body pain relief & Massage-like Modes. Frequency Adjustment: Additional adjustable speed allows you to decide the most comfortable pain relief experience.
Belt Clip Equipped: Non-stop pain relief wherever you are with just one clip.

Millions of HealthmateForever TENS and muslce Stimulators, we'd like to favor our loyal customers and new customers with Free YK15AB medical device with 3 month warranty, we sell this item at price of all accessories ONLY, Limited Time Offer!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
